page.title: 13Festivals in Culcheth
page.content: Culcheth Carnival takes place every July. Different groups floats which are driven in procession around Culcheth before being judged. This year our school, Newchurch C.P., entered a float called "Storyland". Children dressed up as characters out of nursery rhymes and books. We won first prize (Â£25). Each year there is a bonfire on Shaw Street playing fields. It usually has a "guy" on top of it. In the weeks before November 5th you can buy treacle toffee and fireworks at nearby shops. On the night of the bonfire you can buy toffee apples, black peas, soup and drinks. The Carnival and the Bonfire are organised by Culcheth Lions Club. At Christmas there is usually a Christmas tree on the village green. People sing carols around the tree.
